DOC.brief_title: Activin A Inhibin A Predicting Outcome Pregnancies Unknown Location After Assisted Reproductive Technology
DOC.detailed_description: Ectopic pregnancy ( EP ) one common pathology see emergency gynaecology practice . Early diagnostic situation clinical objective remain important cause maternal morbidity mortality worldwide . Currently , transvaginal ultrasound scan ( TVS ) allow ascertain location pregnancy . However , diagnosis EP complicate nonspecific clinical presentation inconclusive result case transvaginal ultrasound first presentation . For reason several biomarkers investigate accurately detect establishment pregnancy predict outcome early possible . These biomarkers include : marker abnormal embryo/trophoblast growth ( β-subunit HCG , Activin A , etc ) , marker abnormal corpus luteum function ( progesterone , inhibin A , etc ) , marker grow pregnancy Fallopian tube ( creatine kinase , vascular endothelial growth factor , etc ) , marker inflammation peritoneal irritation ( cancer antigen 125 , interleukin-6 , etc ) , uterine marker normal implantation ( leukaemia inhibitory factor glycodelin ) . Β-HCG progesterone usually use clinical practice activin A inhibin A recently show promising result .
DOC.criteria: Patients pregnancy unknown location ( PUL ) diagnose 22 27 day oocyte retrieval , first ultrasound routine control ( A `` pregnancy unknown location '' ( PUL ) term use classify woman positive pregnancy test empty uterus sign intrauterine extrauterine pregnancy transvaginal ultrasound scan . ) Patients Intrauterine pregnancy : Viable intrauterine pregnancy ( IUP ) An intrauterine gestational sac contain fetal pole visible cardiac activity Patients Ectopic pregnancy ( Tubal ectopic pregnancy ) : An empty endometrial cavity : ( ) inhomogeneous adnexal mass ( ii ) empty extrauterine gestational sac see hyperechoic ring ( iii ) extrauterine gestational sac yolk sac and/or fetal pole without cardiac activity
